Award.AbstractNarration:
This grant enables student participation at the International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML). ICML is one of the premier conferences in Machine Learning. In addition to rigorously refereed conference papers, it features poster sessions, tutorials, workshops and invited talks. This award provides funds for travel scholarships for students from US institutions to help cover their travel and costs of attending the conference. The selection of students to be funded is based on a review by the selection committee of their authorship and financial needs. The student scholarships are very important for encouraging student participation in this premier conference and for shaping the future of the field as a whole. Special attention will be paid to broadening the participation of students from groups that are traditionally underrepresented in Computer Science in general and Machine Learning research in particular, and students from institutions with limited Machine Learning expertise who would benefit from the opportunity to interact with researchers from around the world.

Attendance at the ICML represents a unique opportunity for students interested in Machine Learning research. The poster sessions at the conference are designed enable students to recieve feedback from leading Machine Learning researchers from around the world and to help them become part of the larger Machine Learning research community. The award contributes to the education and training of the next generation of researchers and educators in an increasingly important area. It also helps broaden the participation of underrepresented groups and women in Machine Learning research.

POR.DRECONTENT:
31st International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML 2014)

The International Conference on Machine Learning is the premier international research conference on Machine Learning, organized annually by the International Machine Learning Society (IMLS). The conference covers the latest developments in all areas of Machine Learning, including innovative work on systems that are self-adaptive, systems that improve their own performance, and systems that apply logical, statistical, probabilistic or other formalisms to the analysis of data, learning predictive models, and interaction with the environment. The work presented includes innovative applications, theoretical contributions, carefully evaluated empirical studies, and work that combines all of these. Research that bridges the gap between Machine Learning and other areas of research, study, and application, is highly encouraged.

In 2014, ICML was held in Beijing, China, from June 21 to 26. Please see http://icml.cc/2014/ for venue, program details, as well as to access full electronic copies of all scientific papers presented at the conference.

ICML 2014 was the most popular event in the series so far. We received 1,248 scientific paper submissions in total and accepted for inclusion in the main program 310 of them, for the acceptance rate of 24.8% which was the lowest over the past several years. In despite of the overseas location, distribution of the ICML 2014 accepted papers was still dominated by work originated in the US (55% of authors), while the remaining contributions spanned across significant research centers from around the world. We had 1,213 participants registered for the main conference program, with several additional registrations for workshops and tutorials. Note that workshop papers have not been included in the statistics above.

The purpose of this grant was to enable ICML 2014 travel and attendance support to students affiliated with the US universities. 

Participation in the ICML represents a unique and valuable opportunity for students interested in Machine Learning research.  We intend to facilitate the integration of graduate students into the research community by providing them with a forum to talk to leading scientists in the field about their Ph.D. research and how it is situated in the broader efforts of the field. The students viewed their experience very favorably.
